DOC.detailed_description: Retrospective review record Emory Movement Disorders clinic suggests vitamin D deficiency occur 80 % patient Parkinson 's Disease ( PD ) , much frequently internal medicine clinic . Laboratory study suggest vitamin D could play role development PD . In addition , low vitamin D level associate slow walk speed , bad memory thinking , depression . About 150 person PD low vitamin D level participate study . Subjects randomly ( like flip coin ) assign either high dose vitamin D supplement ( 54,200 IU weekly ) Recommended Daily Allowance ( RDA ) old person ( 4200 IU weekly vitamin D ) . Subjects examine clinic , 3- 6- month take vitamin D supplement . Tests walk speed , Parkinson 's rating scale , memory test questionnaires mood , anxiety fatigue administer . If study confirm vitamin D deficiency occur 80 % patient , patient may benefit awareness problem increase . Also , study help determine whether vitamin D improve patient ' functioning . Currently , `` standard care '' person low vitamin D. At VA Medical Center , provider use variety supplement regimen . The Institute Medicine ( IOM ) publish 600 IU per day ( 4200 IU per week ) Recommended Daily Allowance ( RDA ) . By definition , RDA amount vitamin supplement prevent 97-98 % population become deficient .
